publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6028 Hugh O’Donnell: Autism Ventures Scotland Launches First Social Firm—That the Parliament congratulates Autism Ventures Scotland on the opening of its first social firm, the gallery on the corner, which will offer six apprenticeships to young people with autism; notes that all the art and crafts on sale at the gallery will be created by artists who have experienced some form of disadvantage in their lives; recognises that the launch of the social firm is part of an overall strategy to support individuals with autism to lead the most productive and fulfilling lifestyles possible, and hopes that the gallery in the corner is the first of many social firms launched by Autism Ventures Scotland.

S3M-6028 Autism Ventures Scotland Launches First Social Firm (lodged on 22 March 2010) Nanette Milne*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Trish Godman*, Jim Tolson*, Kenneth Gibson*, Mike Pringle*, Margaret Curran*, Patricia Ferguson*, Bob Doris*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Jamie Stone*, Robin Harper*, Ken Macintosh*, Bill Butler*, Murdo Fraser*, Marlyn Glen*

S3M-6028 Autism Ventures Scotland Launches First Social Firm (lodged on 22 March 2010) Hugh Henry*, Gil Paterson*, Bill Kidd*, Jackie Baillie*, Elaine Smith*, John Park*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Robert Brown*, Jim Hume*
S3M-6028 Autism Ventures Scotland Launches First Social Firm (lodged on 22 March 2010) Dave Thompson*, Margaret Mitchell*, James Kelly*

S3M-6028 Hugh O’Donnell: Autism Ventures Scotland Launches First Social Firm—That the Parliament congratulates Autism Ventures Scotland on the opening of its first social firm, the gallery on the corner, which will offer six apprenticeships to young people with autism; notes that all the art and crafts on sale at the gallery will be created by artists who have experienced some form of disadvantage in their lives; recognises that the launch of the social firm is part of an overall strategy to support individuals with autism to lead the most productive and fulfilling lifestyles possible, and hopes that the gallery in the corner is the first of many social firms launched by Autism Ventures Scotland. Supported by: Nanette Milne, Mr Frank McAveety, Trish Godman, Jim Tolson, Kenneth Gibson, Mike Pringle, Margaret Curran, Patricia Ferguson, Bob Doris, Ms Wendy Alexander, Jamie Stone, Robin Harper, Ken Macintosh, Bill Butler, Murdo Fraser, Marlyn Glen, Hugh Henry, Gil Paterson, Bill Kidd, Jackie Baillie, Elaine Smith, John Park, Dr Richard Simpson, Robert Brown, Jim Hume, Dave Thompson, Margaret Mitchell, James Kelly, Stuart McMillan*, Angela Constance*, Elaine Murray*
S3M-6028 Autism Ventures Scotland Launches First Social Firm (lodged on 22 March 2010) Nicol Stephen*
S3M-6028 Autism Ventures Scotland Launches First Social Firm (lodged on 22 March 2010) Karen Whitefield*
